Description.p: Ms. Lanius is responsible for the successful delivery of learning solutions to ADEPTCentral clients, overseeing critical facets of practice management such as strategic planning, quality assurance, best practices, and client relationship management.

As an Enterprise Learning Strategist), Ms. Lanius participates in all stages of learning projects as needed, with heavy involvement in the strategy, design, and planning phases. She applies ADEPTCentral's ADEPT methodology to transition clients from instructor-led training to online, or to improve their current learning and delivery environments. A few of the notable learning projects led by Ms. Lanius include:

Concorde Career College offers over 20+ programs in the area of healthcare. Due to the demand for online programs, Concorde Career College partnered with ADEPTCentral and adopted the ADEPT Program to assist restructuring current classes to 100% online. As the Senior ADEPT Program Consultant Ms. Lanius has assisted Concorde with the following milestones:

ul.li: Define and develop a comprehensive end-user based Standards and Best Practices document that will help professors rapidly design and develop Concorde's online programs ensuring that each course will be built in accordance to Concorde's standards. The Standards and Best Practices document ensures that each course is educationally sound, meets student's demands as it relates to accessibility and manageability, leverages Concorde's LMS system and its full functionality, and meets accreditation requirements.

Developed, maintained and managed a master schedule plan to develop three healthcare programs: Bachelors of Nursing, Healthcare Administration and General Core Education that include nearly 60 courses.

Using the ADEPT Program methodology, Ms. Lanius successfully onboard over 30 professors to assist in the restructure of the lesson plans to ensure that the online courses meet the need of each student and course goals that had previously been accredited standards.

Description.p: Cambria-Rowe, for over a century, has educated students in specialized fields of study that result in graduates who are knowledgeable and skilled. Their mission is to transition their traditional classrooms to a blended format offering more flexibility and access to students. Using the ADEPT methods, Ms. Lanius successfully on-boarded over 20 teachers/instructors to the ADEPT rapid development process that helped them quickly transition their classroom training to online. Teachers learned how to flip their lessons plans so that the students could access the reading, lecture and other comprehensive materials online and use the classroom for the applied, application level homework and assignments.

The Kenan-Flagler School of Business launched their first online business certification program, designed to provide non-business majors a competitive edge for job placement in the marketplace. The program educates non-business majors in the areas of finance, accounting, business acumen and communications. The program, designed to gain reach in the market, created an additional revenue stream for UNC. Using the ADEPT method, Ms. Lanius:

ul.li: Led the project through an extensive needs analysis that resulted in an online curriculum with specific objectives designed to help non-business major succeed in a corporate environment
Assisted UNC e-Learning Specialists and Professors in launching theKenan-Flagler Business Essentials Certification Program in a rapid timeframe of five months

Guided the directors & professors of Kenan-Flagler in the optimal use of their online technologies to ensure successful implementation and delivery to potential students, resulting in revenue gains for UNC

Description.p: CHI needed to implement a learning management system (LMS) nationwide, a major initiative that included nearly 70 hospitals and clinics hosting courses online where employees can track and measure training. Ms. Lanius'contribution entailed:

Worked with the Director of Learning Effectiveness to develop and deploy an implementation roadmap, which included areas of employee data transfer, standards/best practices for content development, and role-based training on the usage of the LMS
Cooper Clinic, a health and wellness corporation, decided to move their flagship-training program,

ul.li: Conducted an assessment of their existing learning environment, clients, technologies and training program
From this assessment, developed a proof of concept for the new online environment that provided a clear vision of how Cooper could gain additional revenue through online training
Led the e-Learning consultant team in identifying strengths and weaknesses of Cooper Clinic's initiative

Description.p: As a consultant and senior instructional designer, Ms. Lanius:
Led a design team through the ADEPT process to provide multiple course curriculums for HP's client software product training
This product training was designed to be generic, yet easy to customize for specific client implementations of HP software
Developed standards for the base online training product to ensure consistency and rapid development of training products
National Vision, a national optical corporation, had implemented an LMS system, yet was struggling to transition legacy training to the new system. Ms. Lanius:

ul.li: Provided consultation in the area of catalog development, curriculum management and content transitioning
Identified weaknesses in their environment, such as low bandwidth and outdated computer systems
Created a roadmap for developing role-based training, succession planning, catalog and content development and recommendations for removing environmental access restrictions

Description.p: Two Men and a Truck, a large national moving firm, experienced a high volume of turnover and wanted to use their current Learning Management System (LMS) to speed up the delivery cycle for training new employees. This initiative also included Franchise access and best practices for using and deploying training through the centralized LMS system. Ms. Lanius' responsibilities included:

ul.li: Collaborated with the Director of Training, LMS Administrator and Senior Instructional Designers to provide advanced training on LMS functionality
Guided the Director of Training in developing a long- term improvement plan for the company's training initiative
